alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 08 at 11:08PM CDT until August 08 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT/1145 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHWESTERN WICHITA...SOUTHEASTERN WALLACE AND NORTHEASTERN GREELEY COUNTIES... At 1008 PM MDT/1108 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles south of Wallace, or 13 miles southeast of Sharon Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace and northeastern Greeley Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
